headline: Boeing Jet Production Resumes, Starliner Astronauts Delay Extended
summary: Boeing finally resumes aircraft production at its Pacific Northwest facilities. Starliner astronauts will be stuck on the ISS until March.

headline: Boeing Stock Seen as a ‘Dog of the Dow’ for 2025. That’s Bullish.
summary: TD Cowen transferred coverage of Boeing stock among its analysts. That resulted in a $10 bump to the target price to $200 and a continued Buy rating.

headline: Boeing lands biggest 737 MAX order of the year: 100 737-10s for Pegasus Airlines
summary: The order includes options for another 100 737 MAX 10 jets.  The deal is worth $5.85 billion after typical industry discounts, according to estimated delivery prices from UK-based Cirium Ascend.  Boeing shares rose 2.6%.

headline: Pegasus Airlines Orders Up to 200 Boeing 737-10 Airplanes
summary: Boeing [NYSE: BA] and Pegasus Airlines today announced Türkiye's leading low-cost carrier will grow and modernize its single-aisle fleet with an order for up to 200 737 MAX airplanes. The airline's purchase includes a firm order for 100 737-10 jets – plus options for 100 more.

headline: TD Cowen maintains Outperform Rating on Boeing, expects stock to move quickly
summary: Investing.com -- TD Cowen reaffirmed its Outperform rating on Boeing (NYSE:BA) in a note Thursday, increasing the price target to $200 from $190.

headline: Taiwan's China Airlines splits $11.9 billion aircraft deal between Boeing and Airbus
summary: TAIPEI (Reuters) -Taiwan's China Airlines will split an order for its long-haul fleet renewal between Boeing and European rival Airbus and buy freighters from the U.S. planemaker in a closely watched deal worth almost $12 billion.  Taiwan's largest carrier had been considering the 777X, of which the 777-9 is a variant, and A350-1000 as replacements for its fleet of 10 Boeing 777-300ERs and to provide capacity for future growth, sources have told Reuters previously.  China Airlines said on Thursday that it would buy 10 Boeing 777-9 aircraft and 10 Airbus A350-1000s as well as four 777-8 freighter aircraft for $11.9 billion, with deliveries for the new aircraft starting from 2029.

China Airlines said on Thursday that it would buy 10 Boeing 777-9 aircraft and 10 Airbus A350-1000s as well as four 777-8 freighter aircraft for $11.9 billion, with deliveries for the new aircraft starting from 2029.
